content.description: Start from the ramp below and right of the bottom of the C flake. Friction climb behind the flake on the left-leaning rounded face with three well spaced bolts on three shallow steps. Smaller cams are useful at the start and finish. Belay with gear. Walk off either side to descend, south is easier.
content.location: On the right side of C Cliff, up the ramp to the backside of the big flake and left of the wide low-angle crack.

content.description: From the lowest point on the cliff climb up and left past a bolt to stance on the left. Step right and up  past another bolt to seam and take this to the top. Belay with gear. Walk/scramble off either side to descend, south is easier.
content.location: The left side of the cliff.

content.description: From the lowest point of the cliff follow the ramp to the dyke that comes down from the wide crack on the left side of the C flake. Climb the dyke past one bolt and finish on the wide crack above. Belay with gear. Walk/scramble off either side of the cliff to descend.
content.location: In the center of C Cliff.

content.description: From the lowest point of the cliff climb right on a low-angle ramp to the right end of the flake. Traverse left under the flake then finish straight up the wide crack. Belay with gear. Walk/scramble off either side of the cliff to descend, south is easier.
content.location: On the right half of C Cliff.

content.description: A small facet of rock with fun climbs. Slightly less than vertical and rounding off near the top. The bottom right corner of the cliff is hidden from view by a crook in the hillside.
